purpose.p: An instruction that copies the context item to the result sequence.

usage.p: This instruction is often used in transforms when two schemas have some element structures in common.
Specified element and attribute nodes in the enclosed xsl:apply-templates instruction are added to the output as if they were created by the xsl:element or xsl:attribute instructions.
No child elements of the context node are copied, nor are its existing attributes. To do this you must use xsl:copy-of.
The selected text, processing instructions, comment and namespace nodes are copied entirely.

property.name: copy-namespaces
property.description: Whether or not to copy namespace nodes

property.name: inherit-namespaces
property.description: Whether or not children of a copied node will inherit copied namespaces

property.name: use-attribute-sets
property.description: The space-separated list of attributes names to use for elements
